definition[0]: someone who has invested money into something, or who has some important connection with it, and therefore is affected by its success or failure
example[0]: Citizens should be stakeholders in the society they live in.
definition[1]: someone, usually a lawyer, who takes charge of a property during a quarrel or a sale
definition[2]: someone chosen to hold the money that is risked by people on a race, competition etc and to give all of it to the winner
definition[3]: a person who is considered to be an important part of an organization or of society because they have responsibility within it and receive advantages from it
example[1]: Chief executives of international companies want to spend more personal time on stakeholder issues. By ‘stakeholder’, we mean staff and the local community.
definition[4]: someone who owns shares in a company
example[2]: The organization’s big stockmarket investments make it an important stakeholder in Lebanon’s economy.
